name: Roasted Tomato CCB Soup

ingredients.name: CCB Dip Mix or Cheesy Fries Seasoning
each olive oil and balsamic vinegar
Roasted Garlic Aioli Mix or SPG Seasoning

preparation: Preheat oven to 425° F. Line a Sheet Pan with a Sheet Pan Liner.
Place tomatoes and onion in a bowl; drizzle with 3 tbsp seasoning, oil, vinegar, salt, and pepper. Toss to mix; spread out on Sheet Pan Liner.
Bake until tomatoes are soft, juicy, and starting to burst, about 30 min.

Scrape mixture into a Multipurpose Pot; add broth. Bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer for 10 min to let flavours blend. Working in batches, purée in a blender until smooth. Return soup to pot; stir in remaining 2 tbsp dip mix. Reheat over medium-high, stirring often, until warm. If making ahead, refrigerate up to 3 days or portion and freeze up to 3 months.
To serve, stir yogurt with aioli mix and milk. Spoon soup into bowls and top with a swirl of yogurt mixture. Top with Better Than Bacon Topper , if desired.
perfectlyBalanceYourPlate: Serve with 1 slice whole wheat or sourdough bread with 1 tbsp butter or 2 tbsp avocado. Add a boiled egg in your soup to up your protein.

products.name: CCB Dip Mix
summary: Cheese. Chives. Bacon. How's that for a totally irresistible trio? Our very own smoky vegetarian bacon, made from pinto beans, is the secret star of this oh-so-yummy dip.
This blend is all about versatility and we recommend taking it way beyond the dip bowl—use CCB in any dish that could use a little levelling up.

products.name: Cheesy Fries Seasoning
summary: Who can resist restaurant-style cheesy fries? They’re even better when we bake them at home. Made with aromatic garlic, real Parmesan, and premium quality spices, this versatile seasoning is low in sodium, and free from gluten, artificial flavours, colours, and preservatives. Simply sprinkle it on fries, popcorn, pasta, or veggies for a healthy, cheesy family favourite.
